alert.note: Alert for Doddridge (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 2:53PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern West Virginia, including the following counties, Doddridge, Pleasants and Tyler. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of larger creeks and streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 250 PM EST, gauge reports indicated heavy rain will cause flooding on larger streams, including Middle Island Creek. Flooding is expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... St. Marys, Middlebourne, Paden City, Sistersville, West Union, Friendly, Alma, Lima, Canton, Wick, Smithburg, Hebron, Blandville, Center Point, New Milton, Arvilla, Point Lookout and Avon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
